conbody.p: For this technical preview, the following widgets and API are available for use starting Sametime 12.0.1:
For a list of all the available APIs in the Client Platform, go to:

section.title: Chat widget
section.p: The Chat widget is used to customize your chat UI and make network requests to allow for Sametime functionality in other web applications or pages independent of the Sametime chat or meeting clients.
By default, the server connects to the page URL. You can change this setting via config. For more information, contact HCL Customer Support.

section.title: LiveName widget
section.p:
The LiveName widget allows users to display a user's status on the page. You can utilize this widget to apply the following UI changes:
Display the user's status
Display the user's photo
Display the user's status message along with the user's photo and status
Customize the display name
Display the default user photo and default status as offline when there are no available results or records for a given userId
Add action buttons at the end of the toolbar
Change the status if the user's status message is displayed
Display the default menu options if ShowDefaultMenu is enabled
Start a conversation with the user (launches the chat client)
Start a meeting (launches the meeting client)
Show contact details (popover display of user details)​

section.title: JavaScript API
section.p: JavaScript APIs are core APIs that communicate directly with the Sametime server without using the UI. These APIs are accessible by importing the core component or .js file. These APIs will not have full functional parity with the old browser API in 12.0.1.​

section.title: Sample pages
section.p: Sample pages are provided for demonstrating the inclusion of the Chat and LiveName widgets on a page while showing how various props passed to the widgets can affect display or behavior.​ The pages demonstrating the JavaScript APIs provide examples of logging in through the JavaScript APIs and performing specific actions like setting the status and opening a conversation.
